data.title: T-Mobile subsidiary proposes euro-denominated senior notes offering
data.description:
• T-Mobile US (NASDAQ:TMUS) wholly-owned subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, has proposed a public offering of euro-denominated senior notes.
  • T-Mobile USA intends to use the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Mitsui GAAP EPS of ¥220.70, revenue of ¥10983.29B; reaffirms FY outlook
data.description:
• Mitsui press release (OTCPK:MITSY): GAAP EPS of ¥220.70 for the nine-month period ended December 31, 2024.
  • Revenue of ¥10983.29B (+9.8% Y/Y).

data.title: Rayonier Advanced Materials flags $3.5M per month hit from proposed tariff on Canadian shipments
data.description:
Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) on Monday reported sales of $1.64 billion in 2024, a decline of $4 million from the prior year, and said that it was actively assessing the impact of tariffs, particularly on its Canadian-derived revenues.

In 2024, approximately 11% of RYAM’s total revenues were generated from Canadian Paperboard exports to the U.S.

The company has been proactively pursuing mitigation actions since late 2024 to partially offset these impacts, it said in a statement.

“If the proposed 25% tariff on Canadian shipments to the U.S. is enacted, the company would expect an impact of up to $3.5 million per month while in place,” Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) said.

“Even with these potential tariffs at currently announced levels, the company expects to cover all fixed charges, including maintenance capital and interest expenses.”

For the 2025 cellulose specialties outlook, average sales prices are projected to increase mid-single-digit percentage from 2024 levels, in line with RYAM’s “value over volume” strategy.

2025 cellulose specialties sales volumes are expected to decline versus 2024 levels due to the indefinite suspension of the Temiscaming High Purity Cellulose plant; however, 2025 revenue is expected to be flat to 2024 levels.

For 2024, Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) posted loss from continuing operations of $43 million, an improvement of $59 million from the prior year, while adjusted EBITDA came in at $222 million, a 60% increase from $139 million in 2023.

The core earnings number reflects operational improvements, a supportive supply/demand environment in the core Cellulose Specialties business, and strong shipments at the end of 2024.

data.title: Billerud Non-GAAP EPS of SEK 3.24, revenue of SEK 11.47B; initiates Q1 and FY outlook
data.description:
• Billerud AB (publ) press release (OTCPK:BLRDY): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of SEK 2.10.
  • Revenue of SEK 11.47B (+19.9% Y/Y).
  • Adjusted EBITDA SEK 1,443 million; Adjusted EBITDA margin 13%.
  • Outlook for Q1: Solid market conditions for Region North America. Normal conditions for Region Europe except for cartonboard and coated liner that will remain weak. Pricing continues to offset input cost increase. Temporarily lower sales volumes in Region Europe.
  • Financial targets: Billerud has the following financial targets, where targeted levels for return on capital employed (ROCE) and EBITDA margin are to be achieved over a business cycle. Return on capital employed (ROCE) above 11%. EBITDA margin above 15%. Cash conversion above 80%. Interest-bearing net debt in relation to EBITDA shall be below 2.5 (policy). Dividends of at least 50% of net profit (policy).

data.title: BNP Paribas reports FY results; confirms 2025-2026 trajectory
data.description:
• BNP Paribas press release (OTCQX:BNPQF): FY Earnings Per Share of €9.57, up by +8.9% vs. 2023.
  • Revenues came to €48,831M, up by 4.1% compared to 2023 on a distributable basis.
  • CET1 ratio as of 31.12.2024: 12.9%.
  • 2024 Net Book Value Per Share5 : €93.7, up by +7.0% vs. 2023.
  • Cash dividend : €4.79, up by 4.1% vs. 2023 (payment on 21 May 2025).
  • In addition, a share buyback programme of €1.08bn will be launched in the 2nd quarter 2025.
  • 2025-2026 trajectory: BNP Paribas confirms its ROTE trajectory out to 2026 while specifying the following objectives:Revenues: average growth rate above 5% (including the AXA IM project 11) and ~+4% (excluding the AXA IM project11) for 2024-2026. Jaws effect: ~1.5 points/year on average for 2024-2026. Cost of risk: below 40 bps in 2025 and 2026. Net income: average growth rate greater than 7% for 2024-2026. Earnings Per Share: average growth rate greater than 8% in 2024-2026. Pre-FRTB CET1 ratio: ~12.3% as of 31.12.2025 and 31.12.2026 after the ongoing acquisitions. 2025 RoTE: 11.5%; 2026 RoTE: 12%.

data.title: Beyond Medical Technologies names new CEO
data.description:
Beyond Medical Technologies (OTCPK:DOCKF) appointed Daniel Liu as CEO and as a director of the company.

Mr. Liu replaces Kal Malhi in these roles, following Mr. Malhi's resignation as CEO and as a director, effective January 30, 2025.

Mr Malhi leaves Beyond Medical to pursue other ventures but will remain available to consult for the company as required.

data.title: Diageo Non-GAAP EPS of $0.97, revenue of $10.9B; suspends medium-term guidance
data.description:
• Diageo press release (NYSE:DEO): 1H Non-GAAP EPS of $0.97.
  • Revenue of $10.9B (-0.5% Y/Y).
  • Organic net sales returned to growth and increased $101 million or 1.0%.
  • Leverage ratio of 3.1x (net debt to EBITDA) as at 31 December 2024.
  • Net cash flow from operating activities increased by $0.2 billion to $2.3 billion.
  • Declared interim dividend of 40.5 cents.
  • Free cash flow increased by $0.1 billion to $1.7 billion.
  • Volume (equivalent units) of EU122.8m.
  • "Medium-term guidance has been removed due to the current macroeconomic and geopolitical uncertainty in many of our key markets impacting the pace of recovery. We remain confident of favorable industry fundamentals and our ability to outperform. Instead in the interim, we will provide more regular near term guidance."
  • Fiscal 25 outlook: Organic net sales growth; In the second half of fiscal 25, before the impact of the tariffs, we would have expected to build on the momentum seen in the first half and would have expected to deliver a sequential improvement in organic net sales growth compared with the first half of fiscal 25.
  • Taxation: We expect the tax rate before exceptional items for fiscal 25 to be in the region of 24%.
  • Effective interest rate: Given current market conditions and our debt maturity profile, we expect the effective interest rate for the full year fiscal 25 to be broadly flat year-on-year with fiscal 24, which was 4.3%.
  • Capital expenditure: In fiscal 25, we expect capital expenditure for the full year to be towards the upper end of the previously guided range of $1.3-1.5 billion.
  • Leverage: We expect leverage at the end of fiscal 25 to remain above the target leverage range of 2.5-3.0x (net debt to EBITDA), and ahead of leverage at the end of the first half of fiscal 25.

data.title: Liberty Energy gets new CEO
data.description:
Liberty Energy (NYSE:LBRT) said that its Board of Directors appointed Ron Gusek as CEO and as a member of the Board of Directors.

Additionally, the Board has elected William Kimble as non-executive Chairman of the Board.

These leadership transitions are concurrent with the confirmation of Chris Wright as U.S. Secretary of Energy. Mr. Wright, the founder of Liberty Energy, has served as Chairman of the Board, Director, and CEO since the company’s inception in 2011.

Mr. Gusek brings nearly 30 years of experience as a strategic leader, most recently serving as President of Liberty since November 2016.

data.title: Tit-for-Tat: China hits back with tariffs on U.S. coal, LNG, vehicles
data.description:
China retaliates with a levy of tariffs on imports of multiple U.S. products, including LNG, coal, and more. The government said it would implement a 15% tariff on coal and liquefied natural gas products, as well as a 10% tariff on crude oil, agricultural machinery, and large-displacement cars.

“The US’s unilateral tariff increase seriously violates the rules of the World Trade Organization,” the Customs Tariff Commission of the State Council said in a statement. “It is not only unhelpful in solving its own problems, but also damages normal economic and trade cooperation between China and the US.”

As Trump delays tariffs on Canada and Mexico by a month after last-minute talks with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, China imposed tariffs and said that the countermoves will take effect on February 10.

China’s State Administration for Market Regulation said on Tuesday it is investigating Google (GOOG) on suspicion of violating antitrust laws. Google (GOOG) traded 1.15% higher to $203.55 on Tuesday during pre-market hours.

The Chinese government said that U.S. gene sequencing company Illumina (ILMN) and the owner Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger brands— PVH Corp (PVH) would be added to the “unreliable entity list,” restricting their ability to operate in China, according to an NBC News report.

The 10% tariff that President Donald Trump ordered on China was set to go into effect Tuesday, though Trump planned to speak with Chinese President Xi Jinping in the next few days.

Dear readers: We recognize that politics often intersects with the financial news of the day, so we invite you to click here to join the separate political discussion.

ETFs linked to China: (KWEB), (PGJ), (CQQQ), (FXI), (GXC), (MCHI), (FLCH), (CNYA), (ASHR), and (YINN).

ETS to track the S&P (SP500): (SPY), (VOO), (IVV), (RSP), (SSO), (UPRO), (SH), (SDS), and (SPXU).

data.title: Vodafone Group reports Q3 results; reaffirms FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Vodafone Group press release (NASDAQ:VOD): Q3 Revenue of €9.81B (+4.9% Y/Y).
  • Group service revenue: Grew by 5.6% in Q3 to €7.9 billion and on an organic basis increased 5.2% (Q2: 4.2%).
  • Group Adjusted EBITDAaL: Increased by 2.2% on an organic basis to €2.8 billion.
  • On a year-to-date basis, Adjusted EBITDAaL increased by 3.2% on an organic basis to €8.2 billion.
  • Share buybacks: Third €0.5 billion tranche completed 22 January 2025, with 1.8 billion shares repurchased for €1.5 billion since May 2024. Final €0.5 billion tranche from the initial €2 billion buyback programme commencing today. −
  • Group FY25 guidance reiterated: On track to deliver Group Adjusted EBITDAaL of c.€11 billion and Group Adjusted free cash flow of at least €2.4 billion.
